head.supplied: Melbourne bot. Garden ¶ 3. Febr. 1858. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ In compliance with the request of the honorable the Chief Secretary ¶ I have the honor to inform you, that the appointment of Governm Botanist and of...

div.p: E58/1212, unit 741, VPRS 1189 inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In compliance with the request of the honorable the Chief Secretary
See R. B. Smyth to M, 2 February 1858. I have the honor to inform you, that the appointment of Governm Botanist and of Director of the botanic Gardens of Melbourne is held by Ferdinand James Henry Mueller, the appointment of clerk by John Frederick Charles Wilhelmi and the appointment of Curator by John Dallachi, and that beyond these no offices are held directly under Government in this department.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Secretary of the board for science.
Smyth forwarded M's letter to the Chief Secretary on 5 February 1858.
